citations.narrative:
Primary enclosures are not being maintained to protect the rabbits from injury or escape. There were approximately 35
enclosures with sharp, broken wires protruding into the enclosure or metal feeders that had rusted and jagged edges.
Additionally, there was a single female rabbit that was covered in dirt with muddy feet. Upon questioning, she was
identified as having escaped her enclosure overnight and was returned to her enclosure that morning. Sharp and jagged
edges can cause injury and rabbits can become injured or die if they escape. Primary enclosures must be structurally
sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits from injury, to contain them, and to keep predators out. Correct
by 8/2/23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Kem Singletary, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.53(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Primary enclosures are not being maintained to protect the rabbits from injury or escape. There were approximately 35 
enclosures with sharp, broken wires protruding into the enclosure or metal feeders that had rusted and jagged edges. 
Additionally, there was a single female rabbit that was covered in dirt with muddy feet. Upon questioning, she was 
identified as having escaped her enclosure overnight and was returned to her enclosure that morning. Sharp and jagged 
edges can cause injury and rabbits can become injured or die if they escape. Primary enclosures must be structurally 
sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits from injury, to contain them, and to keep predators out. Correct 
by 8/2/23 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Kem Singletary, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
